headline.main: M'ARTHUR'S FORCES SQUEEZE FOE HARD; ' Contract' Grip on Buna-Gona Coastal Region of New Guinea ENEMY FLOTILLA SIGHTED Four Destroyers Lurking Off Shore -- Three Japanese Planes Shot Down

lead_paragraph: AT UNITED NATIONS HEADQUARTERS, Australia, Wednesday, Dec. 2 (U.P.) -- American and Australian troops slowly are "contracting" their grip on the enemy along a narrow strip of the Northeastern New Guinea coast between Gona and Buna, and four more Japanese destroyers are lurking off shore, apparently attempting to land reinforcements for the beleaguered garrison, the Allied command announced today.
